text: Hi guys! do any of y'all use some tool to sync data over a webhook to a HubSpot custom object? Im in the market for one but most i've been finding (make, zapier, integrately, to name some) does not support custom objects, only the basic contact, company etc object. Happy to hear some recommendations. or am i really looking at a custom solution here?

The developers source of truth should also be version control and not the portal, if you want people working on the same thing then maybe you need a development branch or something along those lines.

We have the theme branch (in Design Manager) locked and only version control deploy accesses those files. Development portals are a bit difficult if you have to operate with contact, company, hubdb data and of course site settings could be different, and you end up with a bunch of dev portals lying around.

The way I like to do it now is to have some /dev/username in design manager, and try not to have the files available for new content, also have the theme and stuff clearly labeled development so that some content manager person is not going to litter production with development modules and then it's a PITA to clean that mess up.

That being said, development portals make sense when working on integrations or some other heavy stuff that would alter important data and so forth.
I’m 99.9% sure the custom integration route is the only way

Is there a way to set up different company names in HubSpot settings?
One portal i’m in has 2 brands/domains (A-brand and B-brand)
I want to set the company name for each domain (<http://domain-a.com|domain-a.com> and <http://domain-b.com|domain-b.com>) and access the company name via hubl. For example `{{ site_settings.company_name }}`
Necesitamos saber si HubSpot permite consumir Api's qu están en JavaScript? lo anterior para poder hacer una integración con Keycloak.
my hunch tells me its in `settings > account setup > business units` but I’m not a super admin and that doesn’t show in this portal
Dang y’all making enterprise customers spend an additional $1k/month to have access to business units :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing: :skull_and_crossbones:
I do imagine all that comes with it was a lot to develop… but dang I’m disappointed i don’t get to use it

Good Day All, I would like to know if there are any resources that show the relationships among the HubSpot objects. I want to develop an automation that exports all deal information, this would also include the contacts and owners of those deals I realize that information isn't stored within the deals table.
Not 100% sure if that is what you are looking for, but there is an ERD Diagram: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/crm-integration-guide/overview>
How to write the Css style on landing page..
And media query to responsive webpage.
